item.description:
Please note the location change.  We are downstairs in their conference room.

 

With JoAnne's help we are having an impromptu get together with Ted this Friday.  Please see the event post here:

http://www.meetup.com/Boston-Predictive-Analytics/events/82038172/

Here is JoAnne's original post:

Hi Reed,
I wanted to reach out to you to see you would like set up a presentation on Apache Drill at the next HUG. Drill is a new Apache Incubator project for interactive analysis of large-scale datasets, inspired by Google’s Dremel. It will allow users to query terabytes of data in seconds, as opposed to minutes or hours. I can arrange for one of the committers on the project to present (Ted Dunning, Tomer Shiran, Keys Botzum).

FYI - here are some more details: http://wiki.apache.org/incubator/DrillProposal?action=AttachFile&do=view&target=Drill+slides.pdf

Let me know if this works and I'll send over the abstract/bio.

Thanks,
JoAnne
item.name: Hear from MapR talking about Drill
